catalog_info.title: Adventure and Fantasy Simulation, 1871-2036: Seminar
catalog_info.notes: Interested students must attend first meeting of class during shopping week to speak with the instructor about course enrollment procedure. Offered jointly with the Graduate School of Design as 4305.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: VES 107, VES 160, and VES 166, or permission of the instructor.
catalog_info.description: Visual constituents of high adventure since the late Victorian era, emphasizing wandering woods, rogues, tomboys, women adventurers, faerie antecedents, halflings, crypto-cartography, Third-Path turning, martial arts, and post-1937 fantasy writing as integrated into contemporary photography, advertising, video, computer-generated simulation, and designed life forms.
